start.title: The Leftovers
start.creator_credit: Carly Wray, John Blair, Warner Bros. Television and John Paino
start.brief_description: When 2% of the world’s population abruptly disappears without explanation, the world struggles to understand just what they’re supposed to do about it. The drama series The Leftovers is the story of the people who didn’t make the cut.

end.title: Everybody's Gone to the Rapture
end.brief_description: Rapture is inspired by the fiction of John Wyndham, J. G. Ballard, John Christopher and other authors who deal with ordinary people in extraordinary circumstances. But it’s also about the end of the world.

links.description: The biblical rapture story hasn’t only inspired TV showrunners, but videogame developers too. The Chinese Room’s Everbody’s Gone to the Rapture lets players explore a small town where everyone has also mysteriously disappeared.

links.description: While Lovecraft takes a surreal approach to racial injustice, When They See Us focuses on the five defendants – all young men of colour – who are railroaded into a false conviction for the 1989 Central Park jogger attack. Michael K. Williams is in both shows.

end.title: The Tall Man
end.brief_description: This is the story of Palm Island, the tropical paradise where one morning Cameron Doomadgee swore at a policeman and forty-five minutes later lay dead in a watch-house cell.

links.description: Tony Krawitz’s The Tall Man, based on Chloe Hooper’s book, explores the death of Indigenous man Cameron “Mulrunji” Doomadgee, who died in police custody on Great Palm Island in Queensland. Like 13th, it aims to expose the racist policies of police through documentary.

links.description: One of the best TV shows of 2019 Watchmen similarly used a fantastical concept – superheroes - as a way to interrogate intergenerational trauma, institutionalised racism and American identity, in a story that features interdimensional squid attacks, catapulting clones and chemical time travel.

links.description: Motion graphics studio Antibody created the mind-bending mix of divinity and depravity that features in the American Gods title sequence. They also applied their otherworldly aesthetic to cosmological horror show Lovecraft Country, which reimagines HP Lovecraft’s monsters to reframe race relations in 1950s America.

links.description: Watchmen was created by Damon Lindelof, who along with Tom Perrotta, also created The Leftovers, based on Perrotta’s novel. Dealing with a rapture like event that sees millions of people around the world disappear, it also uses fantasy to explore grounded themes like grief and existentialism.
